strawberry pal by brilliantbutton ©2024 kalene gardner 2 abbreviations - us terms st- stitch flo front loops only chain chain blo back loops only sl slip_stitch increase increase 2 stitches in 1 skip skip decrease decrease invisible decrease is best single_crochet- single_crochet materials yarn of course pink permanent fabric marker for blush yarn needle tulip brand recommended stitch markers i just use a short yarn practice with this first polyfill stuffing hook sizes f 3 75mm suggested yarn this is what i used but don t be afraid to do your own version i used red heart super saver rhss for the face details and just chenille yarn for the body black 1 yard rhss black pink 12 yards just chenille pink white 1 yard rhss white green 4 yards just chenille lime yardage can vary by person and gauge these are estimates based on my own use it is always good to have a little extra just in case notes -stitch tight enough to keep gaps between stitches closed -this is mostly done in rounds only chain 1 and turn when told to -change color by using the new color in the final pull through of the last stitch in a row don t worry about a perfect color change as it will be hidden by the leaves strawberry pal by brilliantbutton ©2024 kalene gardner 3 please feel free to contact me with any questions you can message me through ravelry or etsy i will do my best to get back to you within 24 hours body round 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in first chain 6 round 2 increase around 12 round 3 single_crochet around 12 round 4 single_crochet increase repeat around 18 round 5 2 single_crochet increase repeat around 24 rnds 6 9 single_crochet around 24 4 row pause to add face i made my face details with worsted weight acrylic yarn but feel free to use what you have note that start of row is in the back eyes should be on the third row down from the working row and 4 stitches apart create these by starting with black going over it 4 6 times and then add a white detail on the outer edge of the eye make the mouth with black the mouth corners should be in the second row below the eyes it is 2 row high and 3 stitches wide it helps to locate the center before sewing the mouth in add blush with a permanent fabric marker don t forget to practice with this first just under the eyes strawberry pal by brilliantbutton ©2024 kalene gardner 4 return to
